qas.question: What is the largest Protestant denomination in Northern Ireland?
What is the largest denomination of the entire Ireland Island?
How many Scottie Presbyterians moved to the northern counties in Ireland?
When was he Presbytery of Ulster formed?
Which religion is the second largest denomination in Northern Ireland?
Which religion is the largest denomination on the island of Ireland?
What did Ulster bring t o Scottish plantation settlers?
How man Irish Presbyterians moved to northern Scotland?
In what year was the Battle of the Ulster?

context: <a0_0><b4_0><b5_0><b6_0>Presbyterianism<b6_0/><b5_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/> is the largest Protestant denomination in Northern Ireland and the second largest on the island of Ireland (after the <a1_0>Anglican Church of Ireland<a1_0/>),[citation needed] and was brought by Scottish plantation settlers to Ulster who had been strongly encouraged to emigrate by James VI of Scotland, later James I of England. An estimated <a2_0><b7_0>100,000<b7_0/><a2_0/> Scottish Presbyterians moved to the northern counties of Ireland between 1607 and the Battle of the Boyne in <b8_0>1690<b8_0/>.[citation needed] The Presbytery of Ulster was formed in <a3_0>1642<a3_0/> separately from the established Anglican Church. Presbyterians, along with Roman Catholics in Ulster and the rest of Ireland, suffered under the discriminatory Penal Laws until they were revoked in the early 19th century. Presbyterianism is represented in Ireland by the Presbyterian Church in Ireland, the Free Presbyterian Church of Ulster, the Non-subscribing Presbyterian Church of Ireland, the Reformed Presbyterian Church of Ireland and the Evangelical Presbyterian Church.
